title: Todd Packer
description: Everyone is up in arms after Michael convinces Holly to give Todd Packer an office job, and Andy gets upset after Pam gets a new computer for reception but not for him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have the best survival stock shelter in north eastern Pennsylvania. But everything has a shelf-life. So I must eat and replace everything that's about to expire. It's nice not to have to plan my meals.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You're eating eight year old tomatoes?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They're still good for another week.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You know, I think I have some type of cheese in the back of my fridge you might like. [Jim smiles]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I've got some cheese you might like too. In between my toes. [all laugh]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hardy har har. Okay picture this:

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: I really though I was becoming too much of a womanizer. I realized I had shirts in five different women's houses.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Still not seeing the problem here.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: All right, truth is I gotta couple love bumps on my ding-dong so, game-over!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was the best of times, it was the awesomest of times. And now Packer wants to come home. And ohh, look who's here to sign off on it! My boo, Holly.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [walks into conference room with Michael and Todd] Hi!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi. [Holly and Michael kiss]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You must be Todd.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [shaking Holly's hand] Whoa! I'm sorry, Michael. I thought we were meeting Holly today, not Jennifer Aniston!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [laughs oddly] Very funny. Okay let's get started.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: After you!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, Michael! This'll be just us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yes yes yes yes. Just so you know, he's at his funniest when you've given him five shots.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And it also helps if you've had five shots.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I already have.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Michael] Why is Packer back?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is Packer here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why's he talking to Holly?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [peering into conference room] Don't know, don't care.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [to Todd] Michael loves you, and your sales speak for themselves.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [excitedly] Oh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sees Holly and Todd shaking hands in the conference room] Yes! The Pack is back! Ladies and gentlemen, I would like to introduce you to a man who needs no introduction, probably because most of you have done it with him. Just kidding he wouldn't be interested in any of you. In all seriousness, Todd Packer, is a permanent salesman at this branch. And I would like to invite you to welcome him with open arms.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What!?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: It's great to be among friends, but until then, you suckers will do!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nice! We got burned!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You did! You got burned, because Packer's back! Packer is turning in his car for a desk. He is turning in his condoms, for a condominium! Although he's probably going to have to use condoms from here on out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [seething] Holly, you approved this?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yes I did, I think Todd's gonna make a great addition to the staff.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You did approve it?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What don't you understand about the word approved? It seems some of you don't know what the word approved means.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I have very little patience for stupidity.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [walking in with Gabe behind her] Sorry we're late. Gabe fell in the shower.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I'm such a klutz!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah, it took the fire department forever to get there. [realizing there's a new computer at her desk. Gets very excited] Oh my God, where did this come from?! Who did this?!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I got Erin a new computer, because the one at reception sucked. I should know. And I don't wanna say the other one was old, but its I.P. number is one! [laughs sheepishly] Right?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thank you Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Awwh, you're welcome. [they hug] My pleasure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Pam walks over to him and smiles excitedly while bouncing, Jim imitates her] Can I do something for ya?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just helped someone out. It feels good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice. You know, I cleaned our daughter for like, an hour at four a.m. this morning, so...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So you know the feeling.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Special delivery for Dwight K. Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I didn't order anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I don't have anything for you. But I do wanna talk to you about something. We have been thinking about where Packer should sit... And we can't just sit around and wait for Creed to die.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well there's a lot of seats in the annex.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So you wouldn't mind permanently relocating, so that Packer can take this desk here. [Jim looks appalled]

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Thanks man, it'd mean a lot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have been sitting here for ten years, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: well I was there for twelve years. Plus my name's carved under the desk.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No it is not.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Is too!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Grunting as he crawls under Dwight's desk. Dwight follows] Let's look at this.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Check it out!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't wanna move desks!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't be a baby! Okay! There it is. Packer was here and so was your mom! [Todd starts humping Dwight and Michael who are still under the desk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do I have any say in this?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [grunting while humping Michael and Dwight] Don't even watch, Halpert!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [in the annex, moving into his new desk. Holds up a red tray with rocks on it] Hey, who's dirt box is this?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, that's our Zen garden.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What do you grow in here, bullcrap? [puts the tray into the garbage]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [walking into the annex with Jim] Hey, um...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Hey, what's up guys?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Don't what's up us! You think you're so cute, with your pretty blonde hair!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa, pull it back. Uhm, why did you hire Todd Packer?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Uhm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He's seriously awful!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Michael's recommendation was glowing! And, honestly, he's been nothing but nice to me!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: That's how he gets you to take off his panties.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Pam starts nodding in agreement] Why are you nodding?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: United front...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Okay, look. We can't fire someone because we don't like him.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Right this isn't the U.S. Government.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What are you referencing?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [seems unsure] Everything... Everything.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Do any of you have any concrete complaints about something he's done?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I mean he humped Michael.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Well if that's the case, I guess I've gotta be fired too. [all groan in disgust]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [looking at his computer, gasps] Hey! Hey you guys! The Armeth Regado video is up, gather around! [no one moves] Check it out! This guy's on a full beam reach. [watching a sailing video on his computer] They're hiking out like mad! Lock 'em up! Lock 'em up! Nice job! Ughh. [computer is frozen, taps the top of it] This computer's a hunk of jjunk.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey sailor! Come watch it over here! [pats her new computer]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Where did you get this?!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Pam gave it to me!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is a sick computer! Gwen Stefani has this computer! [to Pam, in a fake British accent] Uhhh, Pamela! What does a guy have to do to get, ahem, one of them?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You have a computer Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, but if you donated my computer to Africa, it would become world famous as the slowest computer in Africa. So...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, but listen. We just don't have the budget for it. Okay? Reception needed a computer so we got one.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well Andy's desk needs a computer. And, I mean, it's just kinda a coincidence that I work there, but...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, but Reception is a one person department. If I get you a new computer I have to get one for everyone in sales. For Dwight, for Stanley, it would be crazy.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: So something good happening to Stanley is crazy now?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm not asking for one, I need it.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: If you're just handing them out, I want one too.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Phyllis, no body is handing anything out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: See, this is what I'm talking about.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What are you gonna play mange on faster?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry Andy.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Hey what's going on you guys? [walking into the kitchen with Holly, Dwight, and Kevin, with whom he fist bumps] Yeahh! Three muska-queers!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [giggling] Mean but good!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: So, Todd, this must be nice for you getting off the road. You get to spend some time with your daughter.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: I don't know, I love her and all, but she turned into a bitch. Mostly she's great, but some days she acts like her mom. [Holly is un-amused]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Well, some girls go through a phase.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey, your life is so insane! You should write a book!

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Since when did you learn how to read?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I do know how to read though!

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Yeah. You know how to read... a menu!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Todd leaves. Kevin laughs uncertainly] He's right. I mean, I could lose some weight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Kevin, in sumo culture, you'd be considered a promising up and comer.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [walking through the office, notices Andy with Erin's computer set up at his desk] What the heck! Why do you have Erin's computer!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's crazy, right? Erin just wanted me to have it, so we switched.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What? Erin is that true?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [nods] I just thought, he really needed a new computer, and he knew so much about that one.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Erin, it's not up to you. This computer was for reception! Okay? It's not yours to give away.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Pam, when I'm freaking out, I just sorta step back and-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm not freaking out, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: -take a few breaths, and then I ask myself:

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [to Jim] So you two are married to each other now, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: That's sweet. How's the sex?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [continues working]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [walks towards Todd] Hey Packer, I made you some hot chocolate.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: 'Cause I wanna let bygones be bygones. Show you I'm cool. You're the new guy. It's cold out. I made too much. I got this awesome hot chocolate recipe from my wife.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's a lot of reasons! [suspicious]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Drink it!

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: I think I'll pass. The only hot chocolate I'm into is Viva A Fox. [winks]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [interrupts Dwight trying to force feed Todd] Can I talk to you a second?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, this hot chocolate thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: None of your business.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, you know you can't actually poison him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It wasn't poison Jim, it was a laxative. People take laxatives all the time. This is just, a lot more of a laxative. Let me handle this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I really think we should join forces on this one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What do we think, what would drive him crazy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pepto-Bismol, in his hot chocolate.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You've gotta stop with the hot chocolate stuff. I was thinking we can jam his drawers, so they only comes out two inches, then he can see everything in them but he can't get to them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [mocking] Ooh does Edgar Allan Poe know about that one? So sinister! That wouldn't annoy a person at all! Where do you come up with this stuff?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay! Well this isn't my best, but call Froggy101, say that we're the tour manager for Justin Bieber, and we're giving away free tickets, we give him a number to call for the tickets, and it's his own number.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who is Justice Beaver?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He... It's a crime fighting beaver.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why don't you write up your best forty ideas and e-mail them to me. Can you do that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Absolutely, I'll e-mail you a hundred.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, write up your list of one hundred, edit it down to your top forty, then e-mail it to me, and I'll read it over.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Pam. Can I talk to you in private?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know if there's really a private place in this office.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well they put a sign-up sheet on the conference room and I signed us up for three mods. A mod is five minutes. And it started two minutes ago.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [looking confused] You did that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Can we talk about this in the meeting? Because we're a little late.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. [walks to conference room with Andy and stares at the sign up sheet with wonder] When did people sign-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mind if I close the door? [after shutting door in the conference room] What you did out there, earlier, was totally un-cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well what was I supposed to do, let you walk all over me?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You humiliated me in front of every body!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, well I didn't think about it like that. It's just, I can't do anything about it. I can't replace that one unless that computer breaks.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I mean, it's pretty broken already.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, well if it breaks all the way I can get you a new one.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [looks at her knowingly] Pretty sneaky sis. [knocking on conference room door]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [walking in] Hey cats, we got a jazz session in mod six, nine, and twelve. [Pam and Andy exit as Ryan and others holding saxophones walk in, Pam looks at the sign up sheet in awe]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to Jim, the two are alone in the annex] There are over four hundred of these! [indicating a packet of paper]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah I couldn't cut it down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They're all good. So good! Number three:

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Andy is seen clicking random things and warning boxes pop up. He pours coffee on his keyboard, puts bologna with mustard in his CD drive, and many other computer harming things] Allow all cookies? Why certainly! Pop-ups? Yes please! Bit torrent streaming from a Somalian music website? Yeah! Why not? [mock baby voice] Oh I hope you don't get sick Mr. Computer. [computer voice] Why are you doing this to me Andy? [normal voice again] Because I hate your programs!

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [at Hank's with Michael, talking to Hank] And a '76 that's good to boot, I like that. [Hank smiles]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And you made Hank smile, that doesn't happen often. You're very charming. That is something you should take upstairs, and use on people that really matter. [Hank looks irritated again]

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know, Holly mentioned that there were some complaints. And that you had said some things about Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Holly said that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: She was laughing hysterically that whole time!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I guess you said something weird about your daughter?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: She asked me, Michael! It would've been rude not to answer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You've been on the road a long time. And you've been an outdoor cat. And now you have to be an indoor cat, so you can't be peeing all over the walls.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Michael, can I open the kamomo with you. I've been on the road too long. But, I wanna connect with my daughter. And it's not right to call her a bitch in front of strangers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No it isn't.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: You're right. I gotta watch my behavior.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Don't give up on me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I won't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Michael and Todd are walking into the office] Okay, every body. I need you to see this. Because maybe there is somebody here that you all underestimated, who will surprise you. Todd Packer, is going to apologize. Kevin! Front and center, come here.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I got a lot of numbers here to put together.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin, we know that you are just trying to save face, we know that you are hurt and embarrassed.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That's silly. If anything, I should be apologizing to Packer. Because we all know I can dish it, as good as I can take it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, sweetie, no. You shouldn't be apologizing to Packer. That doesn't make any sense. You ready for this? You ready for this? Gentlemen, start your engines.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: I'm sorry if you were offended by my comments earlier.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, like I said, I wasn't offended, but I'll stand here for the big show.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin, do you accept the apology?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Don't do it Kevin, that's the fake kind of apology.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, go back to the annex.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: This is textbook. It's so uncool. Ryan does this to me all the time. Like it's some offense to have feelings. Don't do it Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [muttering] Sometimes you over react.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael how's this supposed to work? Packer's gonna keep saying terrible things, and then he's just gonna make half-assed apologies. And we're back to square one.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Okay. You want an apology? Here it goes. Kevin, I am so sorry. You are skinny, and you are a genius.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That-That was maybe too much. Packer is a survivor of divorce Stanley. Packer doesn't speak with his child, Meredith. Packer never lived up to his parent's expectations, Andy. [Andy looks confused and shrugs] Angela loves pussy cats, and Packer loves-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [cutting in] No! Don't!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was going to say dogs! Okay, you know what, this is over! Apology has been issued! And we're through with it. Packer will be here until the day he dies, just like the rest of us!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [in a car with Andy, by the dumpster you can see a new computer box] So listen, we have to really scuff this up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No no no no no! We can say that the previous owner was a neat-freak. Or an elegant old lady and she just kept it around in case her grand-kids came to visit, but they died and they never came, I think I'm gonna make myself cry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Andy, this is the deal we made.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [watching Pam scrap his computer] That's probably good. That's enough.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We should break this hinge maybe.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Let's not go crazy.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Well thanks, will do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [using fake Southern accent, on the phone with Todd Packer, Dwight is also with Jim] Absolutely, now when you get down there, Jo's a little bit, uh, forgetful. So she may have locked the gate, but what you're gonna do is go ahead, hop it, and just head back to the pool. [Michael walks in on Jim and Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: That sounds weird.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It is weird! Look at you, perceptive. Now I know why Jo's kept her eye on you!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [also In southern accent] And you make sure to get down there and check out that Harry Potter World.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [trying to stop him] Whatever you wanna do in your spare time is up to you!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Harry Potter World is supposed to be faaantastic!

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Apparently, as soon as corporate found out I wanted to come in off the road, Jo offered me a cushy new job in Tallahassee. And here's the best part. I'm a huge alligator nerd. I can name you every genus, every sub species. Also I'm a huge boob nerd.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Check it out and have a free butterbeer on us. Keep the receipt and we'll get ya' back!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [trying to hide from Michael what they're doing, he picks up the phone and talks directly into it] All right, so just pack your bags and, uh, be sure to bring those swimming trunks! Bye now! [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I cannot believe this, you're sending Packer to Florida? Why?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He's a jerk.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He took my desk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, so you're tricking him into flying to Florida?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It wasn't my first choice, Jim had so many better ideas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You have to tell him. You have to tell him what you did.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no. That is not part of the plan. That is actually anti-what we're doing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He is my oldest friend, I am going to tell him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait! Why don't we come up with a plan we're all happy about? [Michael leaves]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [plugging in new computer, acting to make people think he got a bad computer] Pam, how is this thing even any better than my old computer?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Come on Andy! I mean you said you wanted a new computer and this is the best I could do!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Where'd you even find this thing, like, in the corner in the warehouse?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, I found it in a shelf in the corner of the warehouse. [Darryl gives the camera an odd look]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right, well thank you for my garbage computer. [Andy turns it on and looks amazed, clearly happy with it]

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [walking into Michael's office] You're looking at the new face of corporate. Gonna put the "ass", in Tallahassee!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, about that.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Well we gotta go out and celebrate, tonight!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well... I don't know if that's a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Do you have a ball and chain?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, nothing like that at all.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Listen, I'm gonna tell you something that none of these people have the stones to tell you. It's your girlfriend, man. She's uptight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sorry?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: I know this stuff can hurt, but I wish someone had said something to me about my ex-wife. All I'm saying is about a month or so, meet me down in Florida, I'll introduce you to all the local [spanks the air] talent.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [thinks a moment] Sounds great.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: It's gonna be so good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is. [Jim sees them and looks happy] It's gonna be awesome. I think you're really going to enjoy it down there.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I'm sorry about your friend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nah, he's an ass.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [Brooklyn accent] You ahh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [imitating] You ahh.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: What ah you wicked smaht?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No you ahh.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Who ahh?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [kisses her and speaks normally again] You ahh.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: So this new computer you found in the warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yep. Lucked out.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, you really did. 'Cause I know every INCH of that warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yep, super lucky.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Maybe you could go back down there and see if you can find me some extra sick days.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [hesitating at the bribe] Yeah. You know what , I think I saw ONE sick day down there.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Really? 'Cause I think maybe I saw five.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Three. [Daryl nods]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm full on corrupt!
